comments.body: Did we get rid of all the flags that affect the component config?

> Did we get rid of all the flags that affect the component config?

We shouldn't. Please check the latest commit which reset the deprecated settings which have been parsed by flag.

This change of behavior needs to be documented in `AddFlags` in deprecated.go

But I wonder if we are safe to tighten the validation instead: fail if a policy is provided along with a config file. I think we have feature parity between policy and plugins now. So everyone should be able to migrate. The flags have been deprecated for a long time, so it should be fine.
but there are flags in CC that users can't set in policy.
updated the note.
IRRC policy flags cause an error when used with config
I enabled policy-config to be set with componentconfig (to ease the deprecation transition) in https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/92531

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +153,157 @@	fs.StringVar(&o.ConfigFile, "config", o.ConfigFile, `The path to the configuration file. The following flags can overwrite fields in this file:
  --algorithm-provider
  --policy-config-file
  --policy-configmap
  --policy-configmap-namespace`)

comments.body: You could call ApplyAlgorithmSourceTo before this and check that .AlgorithmSource.Policy is empty

done

also note, that we can't check if `algorithmSource.Provider` is empty because when any config is provided the default algorithmProvider value is [set by conversion to the internal type](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/ec36ff40016e1ea612ae364b3b550cd31dd04651/pkg/scheduler/apis/config/v1beta1/conversion.go#L53). Not sure if this matters, but I was checking against that before too
any reason this diverges from the common pattern of a `AddFlags` func?
Looks like it wasn't placed in its own package

Oh, most options have a wrapper around the versioned config struct with an AddFlags() method bound to the type.

Given this is already in an options struct, a simple function seems ok.

It seems no generic options in the scheduler.
```suggestion
```
I would still expect that we will refactor it to some options in component-base/metrics like https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/85266

in addition to tolerating missing kubeconfig, this needed to tolerate forbidden failures in `lookupMissingConfigInCluster`... nothing granted the scheduler delegated authentication permissions by default

xref https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/71743
If I upgrade a cluster from 1.11, can a previously working scheduler start to fail because of validation?  Ie can this validation cause failures on upgrade?

Sorry, im not familiar with the kubeadm upgrade process, but I would assume yes. 

@bsalamat should know more

I do not expect failures. The validations we are doing here are basic checks to ensure that the values are in the expected range. These validations would fail only when the provided config do not comply with the documented values in the API.
we apply the options to the config struct *first* (which handles loading config from a file), then use the `c.ComponentConfig....` for the rest of the function
I would really to understand advantages of Deprecated and not fetching its fields  directly from ComponentConfig above?

`Deprecated` captures the code that should go away from the code that is in the future shape.

The fields here exist for the same reason they existed before, all this is just copied, separated for the upper reason, i.e. to hide the ugly: https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/60372/files#diff-f072139971e3329bef6da077a5a03aceL89

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +58,62 @@	Authentication          *apiserveroptions.DelegatingAuthenticationOptions
	Authorization           *apiserveroptions.DelegatingAuthorizationOptions
	Deprecated              *DeprecatedOptions

	// ConfigFile is the location of the scheduler server's configuration file.

comments.body: as i understand, this may not be needed here. you could just use this function above in options/insecure_serving.go.
What do you mean by "this function above"?
IMHO, it feels confusing to me as combining deprecated and non-deprecated fields unless i am missing something.
alternative name?
O.Deprecated.AddFlags and O.ComponentConfig.AddFlags?

Not sure I can follow. I think we are talking at cross purposes.

`o.ComponentConfig` is the component config API type. We cannot attach methods and especially don't want to mix flags with them.



> It feels confusing to me as combining deprecated and non-deprecated fields

To my understanding all flags in `Deprecated` are deprecated, compare the old comment https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/60372/files#diff-f072139971e3329bef6da077a5a03aceL110. I only copy their definition here.

I agree that we should unify the way we technically deprecate the flags. Some have `MarkDeprecated` (and therefore disappear from `--help`), some don't.
